edu.northwestern.at.utils.corpuslinguistics.tokenizer
Interface WordTokenizer

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractWordTokenizer, ApostrophesAreNotQuotesWordTokenizer, ContractionTokenizer, DefaultWordTokenizer, EEBOWordTokenizer, ICU4JBreakIteratorWordTokenizer, NoopWordTokenizer, PennTreebankTokenizer, WhitespaceWordTokenizer
public interface WordTokenizer

Interface for tokenizing a string into "words".

Method Summary
 void addWordToSentence(java.util.List<java.lang.String> sentence, java.lang.String word)
          Add word to list of words in sentence.

          Find starting offsets of words in a sentence.

Method Detail

getPreTokenizer

PreTokenizer getPreTokenizer()
Get the preTokenizer.

Returns:
The preTokenizer.

setPreTokenizer

void setPreTokenizer(PreTokenizer preTokenizer)
Set the preTokenizer.

Parameters:
preTokenizer - The preTokenizer.

addWordToSentence

void addWordToSentence(java.util.List<java.lang.String> sentence,
                       java.lang.String word)
Add word to list of words in sentence.

Parameters:
sentence - Result sentence.
word - Word to add.

extractWords

java.util.List<java.lang.String> extractWords(java.lang.String text)
Break text into word tokens.

Parameters:
text - Text to break into word tokens.
Returns:
List of word tokens.

Word tokens may be words, numbers, punctuation, etc.

findWordOffsets

int[] findWordOffsets(java.lang.String sentenceText,
                      java.util.List<?> words)
Find starting offsets of words in a sentence.

Parameters:
sentenceText - Text from which tokens were extracted.
words - List of words extracted from sentence text. N.B. If the words aren't from the specified sentence text, the resulting offsets will be meaningless.
Returns:
int array of starting offsets in sentenceText for each word. The first offset starts at 0. There is one more offset than the number of words -- the last offset is where the word after the last word would start.

preprocessToken

java.lang.String preprocessToken(java.lang.String token,
                                 java.util.List<java.lang.String> tokenList)
Preprocess a word token.

Parameters:
token - Token to preprocess.
tokenList - List of previous tokens already issued.
Returns:
Preprocessed token. The token list may also have been modified.

close

void close()
Close down the word tokenizer.
